website_summaries.verdict: One of the biggest franchises of the past 3 years offers up a feature-rich, lush gaming experience. It’s marred slightly by the need to sidestep microtransactions.
pros: Adds much more depth to its predecessor, Shadow of Mordor
cons: Final section of the game is a letdown
Players are less than thrilled with the constant microtransaction prompts

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a short time, but too repetitive
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the first game and thought this would be just as much fun. This game gets repetitive quickly. I usually play games to the 100% quest mark and to do that with this game, you constantly have to protect your fortresses by playing siege missions. It gets old fast. I also wasn't a fan of the micro transactions they have for loot boxes. You don't have to buy them to beat the game but you do have to collect enough miren to get more captains later which can be done in normal game play. It just felt like gambling when you had to use the loot boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Colin C.

customer_reviews.title: I found that the initial game was very fun and engaging relative to what is supposed to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I found that the initial game was very fun and engaging relative to what is supposed to be the star of the game, the unique awesome Uruks. However, I quickly lost interest as the late game was very tedious and seemed pointless. Why search for a perfect Uruk when in order to get him, I have to ruin him in the process? That and I kill/lose some many of the buggers that the names etc keep repeating and I dont develop any emotional ties to them. I hate to say it and I didnt believe it at first when everyone was complaining about it, but the fact of the matter is that loot boxes ruined this game.
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Cool sequel to a great game. Shadow of Mordor and Shadow of War are a lot more fun than watching the movies most of the time. This gold edition is fairly cool because it comes with a steelbook. It's a steelbook with a cardboard-like sleeve. It's not good of a steelbook as the Yakuza Kiwami and Kiwami 2 steelbooks, but it's still a steelbook version that has some cool-looking artwork on it. Would definitely recommend as the best value for the game if you want the game + all the DLC in one package. The DLC comes with a voucher (which is never good, DLC ought to be on disc), so get it new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun enough
customer_reviews.text: Provides something I always wanted from the first: greater variety and more maps. Some orcs are often a bit too goofy, which contrasts too much with the rest of the setting. Also, loot crates are a thing. Fortunately, your loot-crate orcs don't tend to scale well as you level up since their quality is based on your level when you open, earn, or buy them. They can also be purchased with in-game currency instead of real money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game play, better than the first one.
customer_reviews.text: My fiance hasn't stopped playing, it since it arrived, except for the week he was not at home and therefore literally couldn't play it. Play style is similar to the Batman games (Arkham Knight), and the visuals are nice (as the person who's stuck watching for hours on end). No issues with disc.
customer_reviews.author: Dookwah

customer_reviews.title: Good Game - Gold Edition
customer_reviews.text: It is definately a good game. If you liked the first game then you will most likely appreciate this one because it basically just improves and scales up everything from Shadow of Mordor. Story is ok, with some missions feeling very unique and entertaining and others feeling underwhelming, nothing revolutionary there. Micro transactions really dont effect the gameplay in any way. Only problem is that monolith kind of spoiled a huge portion of the game with their endless advertisement and non stop gameplay reveals before the games release.
customer_reviews.author: Nicodemus

customer_reviews.title: Not really as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: I hate micro transactions. Thankfully by the time I got this those were removed. Still, you can tell they were a core part of the game. Shame that. Not quite as good as the original because it's just so much bigger. So freaking big it's almost annoying. But then again I've never really played a game as big and deep as this one before so maybe it's just me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pring

customer_reviews.title: It's Middle-Earth: Shadow Of War. What can one say!
customer_reviews.text: Come on! It's Middle-Earth: Shadow Of War! Not much is better And with the DLC pack, man! And with the many cut-scenes and the conversation among your enemies, it's like watching a movie. A comedy most time, with the things they say! Very funny! You can watch videos of just the cut-scenes,"Bring popcorn!"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's not as good as the first but it is fun it's own ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not as good as the first but it is fun it's own right, it takes a minute to realize why the captains seem so much easier but once you realize how frequently you have to battle them it makes sense. Often times you will fight 3-5 at once and you will find captains around seemingly every corner.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Burton

customer_reviews.title: If you love LOTR then it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't played this one yet, but Im a huge LOTRs fan. Love the case work and graphics. Only complaint is the case had a huge scratch across its surface.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha J Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Very good game. But the end game is a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good game. But the end game is a bit boring if the player didn't pay for micro transportation. Not recommending paying for micro transportation you can get everything in the store by doing daily quests and earn the gold for it
customer_reviews.author: Ayman Aleskafi

customer_reviews.title: Return to Mordor
customer_reviews.text: If you thought they couldnt make it better you are so wrong, amazing new abilities and storyline in unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Same button masher, but great game.
customer_reviews.text: The story is much better than it's predecessor. Still the same button masher; but so much more brought to it. What i really like is the unpredictability of your army. Are they going to turn on you, or stay loyal to the end? The nemesis program is much better too; it really makes you feel like you habe a true to form rival enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. McIlrath

customer_reviews.title: The Power Of The New Ring Reigns Supreme
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as the first one, if not better. the nemesis system was worked on greatly and the story was great. so many orcs with different personalities, so much possibility to build the best army to rule mordor
customer_reviews.author: Ronald King

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the focus on microtransactions, but I just ignore that aspect of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Blodreina

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game!!!
customer_reviews.text: If your a fan of the first game this is a must buy. It’s very good
customer_reviews.author: John Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves it. Difficult enough to keep his interest, but not so hard that you get frustrated and tired or playing. Game play and graphics are stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Mo W

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, if you like the 1st one, you will love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Axedon

customer_reviews.title: Fun for awhile
customer_reviews.text: Fun game but I haven't touch it since I beat it, I heard they release some new stuff but not really interested, it does lose its charm after a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Matias

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game, it's a lot of fun. I've put over 60 hours into it and didn't spend any money on the in-game transactions.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M Trausch

customer_reviews.title: Great game, good price
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game and good price for all the dlc and such!
customer_reviews.author: Cats Paw

customer_reviews.title: Like the first game in the series there is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Tough game for an old guy. Like the first game in the series there is a learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: James Linnear

customer_reviews.title: Fun game. I like how it continued the story ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. I like how it continued the story from the last game. Gets a bit repetitive though. Doing the same things just different levels.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good game fun to play and love the nemesis system
customer_reviews.author: Dark

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Loved the first one. Second is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Repetitive but entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent game and my first in the series. Took away a star because for me it got very repetitive after clearing a few of the keeps.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Great game. I know there have been complaints about the microtransactions, but you don't have to buy anything. Just work hard and grind it out. It's still fun and rewarding.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.text: Great sequel to first game. Open world, great story, smooth game play.
customer_reviews.author: robert long

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for my gamer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift for my son and he is VERY happy with it. Didn't come out of his room for days I think! (I know...parenting fail).
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Ashley

customer_reviews.title: The product was a bit damaged (steelbook was bent in ...
customer_reviews.text: The product was a bit damaged (steelbook was bent in and the cover slip was ripped a bit), but the game itself and all its add-ons work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Benn Autrey

customer_reviews.title: Fun but repetitious
customer_reviews.text: Fun game but is very repetitive. Worth the cost for the nemesis system, which is a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game that expanded on the previous title
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game that expanded on the previous title. Non-canon, and doesn't try to be. Do not get offended by the liberties that WB takes that depart from the canon Tolkien lore.
customer_reviews.author: Hilario Navarro II

customer_reviews.title: Great gameplay and interesting storyline, improved from the last game.
customer_reviews.text: Acts 1-3 of the game: pure gold, game of the year quality story line and gameplay. Act 4 of the game: actually trash. Just skip all the grinding and watch the end cut scene on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought the cover art was really cool
customer_reviews.text: I’m not much of a gamer, but I purchased this for my husband as a Christmas gift. Needless to say, he was very very excited about it. I thought the cover art was really cool
customer_reviews.author: Bettyboopnilly

customer_reviews.title: This game is easily the game of the year
customer_reviews.text: This game is easily the game of the year! There is so much to do it’s unreal!! It does get repetitive at times but is more fun once new areas/items are discovered. For those complaining of micro transactions don’t let that stop you from getting this game. You do not have to buy anything if you don’t want. If time limited to you then it maybe a good idea since it does take time to gain items, but honestly that’s the point of this game. Keep playing and keep earning cool things!! Overall, I am truly enjoying this game and hope more continues!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Great game first one was good this game is amazing ...
customer_reviews.text: Great game first one was good this game is amazing entirely improved on everything that was wrong about the first one highly recommend this game for any more of the rings fan or action fan or if you're a fan of assassins creed
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Crazy
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t have one problem with the game loved the story over all but the gameplay had me twisted the whole time 😂
customer_reviews.author: Jason fultz

customer_reviews.title: Epic battles and nice story. Invating and defending fortresses is fun
customer_reviews.text: Epic battles and nice story. Invating and defending fortresses is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing even for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, came on time and was a lot cheaper than other places.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great game, don't know if is worth it the gold edition
customer_reviews.author: Yaotl

customer_reviews.title: Repetitive Game like the original
customer_reviews.text: Bigger world more to do but still has repetitive missions Fighting is great
customer_reviews.author: Joel V.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best Game Ever !! If you love the first one, you will LOVE this one.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: Bugs everywhere. Game killing bugs at that!
customer_reviews.text: There is a bug in the beginning of the game that stops you from progressing Amy further. They are aware of this and flat out don't care. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME AT THIS TIME. Wait until bug is fixed. At this rate, maybe next year. I have moved on to at other games.
customer_reviews.author: Rexspook

customer_reviews.title: Great for the first quarter
customer_reviews.text: The first half of the game is great. Just an extension of the first game. But then it degrades into defending your fortresses from sieges, grinding for stronger orc warchiefs, or paying real money for loot boxes. The amount of game play before the sudden switch in the game mode is not enough to justify the price.
customer_reviews.author: J Samland

customer_reviews.title: Superb Product
customer_reviews.text: By far one of the best games out there. I beat Shadow of Mordor multiple times and as soon as I heard about this game, I couldn't wait for it. I ordered it with one-day shipping to get it as soon as possible. I couldn't play it until the weekend but when I played it on Saturday, I played for like 6 hours straight without even knowing! Great game and extremely addictive. Also, I love the graphics and nemesis system, makes the game more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf The Grey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Luvd da first one and this game was incredible despite those freckin pay-to-win loot boxes
customer_reviews.author: Jtim

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: One of the best game this year along with horizon zero dawn and zelda. No need to worry about gold loot boxes, you don’t need to buy those crates to get stronger. Every item in this game is collectible without gold mirian.
customer_reviews.author: Finza

customer_reviews.title: EPIC GAME!!!
customer_reviews.text: SUCH an incredible game!!! I love the depth and the fortress assaults! I can't wait for the DLC to come out for it since the Gold edition came with the additional content!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Learn in the game right now. Not light at all!,
customer_reviews.author: C. brown

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I played through Shadow Of Mordor a number of times, trophy hunted it, and basically bled it dry for everything it was worth! I loved that game and now as I am chugging through Shadow of War I notice all the little things that were lacking in Shadow Of Mordor being put to rest and changed or evolved to be far beyond my expectations! Shadow Of War is, to say the least, BIGGER, better, more comprehensive, smoother, deeper in story, and endlessly fresh. In summary I recommend this to any lover of Middle Earth Lore, player of Shadow Of Mordor, or gamer looking for a fresh and very enjoyable RPG experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This games is awesome!! Way better than the first one in every way!!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cool case received super fast unfortunately case was damaged which ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool case received super fast unfortunately case was damaged which sucks it was a gift
customer_reviews.author: Amanda lea ottmers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super cool case! I'm sure he'll love it! It's for Christmas!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't rush to buy.
customer_reviews.text: Full of bugs, wait for it to be fixed or download it...
customer_reviews.author: Bar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great game, and better then the first one in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Cody Muse

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: i thought it would be better then the first one and it wasn't
customer_reviews.author: Tara B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good game having fun better then the first game you do have to grind but that's what games are about loot boxes are there but u ain't pressured into buying them
customer_reviews.author: Roy G.

customer_reviews.title: Buggy with Pay to Complete
customer_reviews.text: Eventually you will hit a pay wall where you are either forced to grind or pay more money to finish the game. The game has countless bugs in it, infuriating button lag, followers randomly die for no reason, and worst of all Mirian can literally just disappear (I had just over 150,000 Mirian after selling gear, played a few missions, then wanted to buy some chests and all my Mirian was gone.)
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: What a Game! First play through took about 60-70 ...
customer_reviews.text: What a Game! First play through took about 60-70 hours and I am ready to dive back in for another one. For those people on the fence about whether this is a true sequel for just a remake with a few changed mechanics. Let me tell you, you are wrong. Almost every system has improved while still adding more mechanics that just make the experience grand. I can't even finish this review I have to start playing again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shadow of War Has Amazing Graphics
customer_reviews.text: This video game blew my mind. Always something to do whether you pick fights, go after achievements, or enjoy draining the life out of an opponent. The graphics are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Dented steelbook
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I had was my steelbook was dented, I understand it's been an entire year since this game has been released. But I still got semi damaged product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

product_meta.title: Middle-Earth: Shadow Of War Gold Edition - PlayStation 4
product_meta.description: Platform:PlayStation 4| Edition:GoldThe sequel to the critically-acclaimed Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor - winner of over 50 industry awards - arrives this August, continuing the original story of Talion and Celebrimbor, who must now go behind enemy lines to forge an army and turn all of Mordor against the dark lord, Sauron. Immerse yourself in the epic war for Middle-earth as you confront the Dark Lord Sauron and his Ringwraith's. Forge a Ring of Power to dominate your enemies and command your followers as you experience a unique, personal story brought to life by the award-winning Nemesis System.
feature_bullets: Gold Edition includes: Two nemesis expansions, Slaughter Tribe and Outlaw Tribe and it also includes two story expansions, The Blade of Galadriel and The Desolation of Mordor
Experience a richer and more personal world full of new enemy types, stronger personalities and deeper stories - anyone you face can now evolve from a lowly soldier to a mighty overlord
Go behind enemy lines and use strategy, cunning or brute force to conquer Sauron' s fortresses and turn them against him

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars181 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
